meanings.definition: The practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from indulgence.
meanings.sent1: Some monks follow asceticisms by fasting regularly and living simply.
meanings.sent2: Asceticisms can lead to a disciplined and controlled way of life.
meanings.sent3: The asceticisms of avoiding sweets and TV made him the healthiest person in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to asceticisms was like a fortress against temptation.
meanings.sent5: The asceticisms of waking up at 5 am every day became his secret to success.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that a person can attain a high spiritual and moral state by practicing self-denial, self-mortification, and the like.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, asceticisms are believed to bring spiritual enlightenment.
meanings.sent2: The asceticisms of meditation and prayer are central to his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: His friends found his asceticisms of giving up social media amusing.
meanings.sent4: The asceticisms of the mind are harder to master than those of the body.
meanings.sent5: She embraced asceticisms as a path to inner peace and harmony.
